unnormalised: Hey everyone! Been getting a lot of questions lately about my yoga routine, so thought I'd share a bit about my journey and some practices I've found super helpful.
normalised: Hey everyone! Been getting a lot of questions lately about my yoga routine, so thought I'd share a bit about my journey and some practices I've found super helpful.

unnormalised: I started yoga about 5 years ago at a small studio in Rishikesh. Initially, it was just to improve my flexibility (I was practically a human pretzel before!), but it quickly became so much more. It's now an integral part of my lifestyle and wellness.
normalised: I started yoga about five years ago at a small studio in Rishikesh. Initially, it was just to improve my flexibility (I was practically a human pretzel before!), but it quickly became so much more. It's now an integral part of my lifestyle and wellness.

unnormalised: *   **Surya Namaskar:** Start my day with at least 5 rounds – energizes me like nothing else.
normalised: *   **Surya Namaskar:** Start my day with at least five rounds – energizes me like nothing else.

unnormalised: *   **Pranayama:** Anulom Vilom and Kapalabhati – helps calm my mind and improves focus. Learned these from Dr. Sharma's online course, highly recommend!
normalised: *   **Pranayama:** Anulom Vilom and Kapalabhati – helps calm my mind and improves focus. Learned these from Doctor Sharma's online course, highly recommend!

unnormalised: *   **Asanas:** Depending on the day, I'll do anything from Trikonasana to Virabhadrasana. Building a small yoga space of about 100 sq ft in my balcony for these.
normalised: *   **Asanas:** Depending on the day, I'll do anything from Trikonasana to Virabhadrasana. Building a small yoga space of about one hundred square feet in my balcony for these.

unnormalised: *   **Meditation:** Even just 10 minutes of guided meditation before bed makes a huge difference in my sleep quality. I use an app with chants in Sanskrit.
normalised: *   **Meditation:** Even just ten minutes of guided meditation before bed makes a huge difference in my sleep quality. I use an app with chants in Sanskrit.

unnormalised: It’s not about achieving some crazy pretzel pose, it’s about connecting with yourself. I still have days where my balance is off or I feel stiff, but that’s okay! The key is consistency and listening to your body. Plus, you don’t need expensive equipment! Just a mat and a willingness to try. My mat cost me Rs. 500!
normalised: It’s not about achieving some crazy pretzel pose, it’s about connecting with yourself. I still have days where my balance is off or I feel stiff, but that’s okay! The key is consistency and listening to your body. Plus, you don’t need expensive equipment! Just a mat and a willingness to try. My mat cost me rupee five hundred!

unnormalised: What are your favorite yoga practices? Share them in the comments! I’m always looking for new things to try! Namaste!
